role_admin.title: role_admin
role_admin.description: An entity representing an administrative role. The existence of a document with the user's UID in the 'roles_admin' collection grants them admin privileges.

uid.description: The UID of the user with admin role.

assignedAt.description: The timestamp when the admin role was assigned.

PageContent.title: PageContent
PageContent.description: A generic entity to hold editable content for various pages, identified by the document ID.

id.description: The unique identifier for the content, typically matching the page slug or a section name.

title.description: Main title for the page or section.

body.description: Main body content, can be multi-line.

ctaText.description: Text for a primary call-to-action button.

definition.description: Stores the content for the homepage. Only admins can modify the content.

params.name: homePageId
params.description: The ID of the homepage document. Should be a single, well-known ID (e.g., 'main').

definition.description: Stores editable content for various site pages. The document ID corresponds to the page or section (e.g., 'why-us', 'faq', 'contact').

params.name: pageId
params.description: The unique ID for the page content.

definition.description: Collection to store admin roles. Existence of a document with the user's ID grants admin access.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to manage the content of the CMXS Jur√≠dico homepage and other static pages, allowing administrators to easily update texts and images. A collection `homePageContent` stores the homepage data, while a generic `pageContent` collection stores content for other pages, using the document ID to identify the page. An admin role is used to control write access to all content collections.
